page.title: 18 STONE MINES AT FARLEIGH.
page.content: The main entrance is at{Main West at{Farleigh Rise.}There are several "satellite" shafts and passages nearby including{Dapstones,Swan {(Kingsdown),Longs Platt,}and{Norbin {Barton}- all these are in our survey area but there are more besides. All these were originally{stone mines which opened about 1780. The stone was too soft for building, but was used in {interior decoration.}Some stone was used in{Buckingham Palace. There are many stories of the{quarry {men}who worked here, including the sad case of a man who was crushed by a stone that fell of a cart. A memorial tablet was built into a stone wall near Dapstones at Monkton Farleigh. There was a{tram line,}connecting with the railway, which carried stone down the hill. {--- More on page 19!
